intro: Ruehssia micrantha, commonly known as the small-flowered ruehssia, is a species of flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, white or pale yellow flowers and opposite, elliptical leaves. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments within tropical forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
